net.uniform.api

Interface Decorator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDecorator, AbstractSingleElementDecorator, ElementErrorsDecorator, FormErrorsDecorator, HTMLTagDecorator, LabelDecorator

    public interface Decorator

    A decorator is used to alter any previously rendered HTML, normally in order to extend it. It can be applied to a single Element by using the addDecorator method. It can also be applied to a group of elements in a Form by using the startDecorator and endDecorator method, defining the decorated range.

    For example, a decorator like ElementErrorsDecorator adds any validation errors in the element to the HTML rendered by the element.

    Decorators can be chained, so a decorator may receive HTML produced by an element and other decorators executed before this decorator.

    Author:
    Eduardo Ramos

    • Method Detail

      • render

        List<SimpleHTMLTag> render(Form form,
                           List<Element> elements,
                           List<SimpleHTMLTag> rendered)
        Decorate the previously generated HTML.
        Parameters:
        form - Form of the element, might be null
        elements - List of elements being decorated. It will be a list of 1 element for an decorator applied to a single element.
        rendered - Rendered HTML so far
        Returns:
        Decorated HTML

      • getProperty

        Object getProperty(String key)
        Obtains a property of the decorator by key.
        Parameters:
        key - Property key
        Returns:
        Propert value

      • hasProperty

        boolean hasProperty(String key)
        Indicates if the decorator has a value for the property (even null).
        Parameters:
        key - Property key
        Returns:
        True if a value is set, false otherwise

        value - Property value

        Map<String,Object> getProperties()
        Returns all the properties of the decorator indexed by key.
        Returns:
        All properties in a map, will never be null
